concept.title: Defining and Using a Tag
concept.shortdesc: A tag is an optional record header attribute that you can define for sets of files. In the pipeline, you can use a function to return the value of the tag attribute.

conbody.p: File Tail origintag record header attributeDefine a tag attribute so you can easily reference tagged records. Use the Tag property to define a tag for a set of files associated with a path. Note that when you use wildcards or glob patterns in a path to represent several sets of files, those files would all use the same tag.
In the pipeline, you can use the following expression to return the tag attribute:record:attribute('tag')

For example, when you use two different paths to tail files from two servers, you can tag the records ServerA and ServerB. In the Stream Selector, you can use the following conditions to separate the data to two different branches of the pipeline:${record:attribute('tag')='ServerA'}${record:attribute('tag')='ServerB'}
